line.words: Una mañana, Emil se levanta cómo siempre. A Emil le gustan las rutinas. Él siempre le da de comer a su gato en las mañanas pero en esta mañana había algo mal.

subtitle.line: One morning Emil wakes up as usual. Emil likes his routines. He always feeds his cat in the morning. But this morning something is wrong!
One morning Emil wakes up as usual. Emil likes his routines. He always feeds his cat in the morning. But this morning something is wrong!

line.words: Su gato no está aquí! Emil busca por todas partes pero no encuentra a su gato. Después, ve una nota en la mesa de la cocina.

subtitle.line: His cat is not there! Emil looks everywhere but cannot find his cat. Then he sees a note on the kitchen table.
His cat is not there! Emil looks everywhere but cannot find his cat. Then he sees a note on the kitchen table.

line.words: La nota dice, —Si quieres a tu gato de regreso, tienes que viajar por el mundo y recolectar 3 pistas. Debes empezar en España. Busca a alguien que vaya hacia la escuela en cada país que visites.

subtitle.line: The note says: ‘If you want your cat back you have to travel around the world and collect 3 clues. You must start in Spain… Look for someone on their way to school in each country you visit.’
The note says: ‘If you want your cat back you have to travel around the world and collect 3 clues. You must start in Spain… Look for someone on their way to school in each country you visit.’

line.words: Emil ama a su gato y empieza a empacar de inmediato. —¿Qué haces cariño? —pregunta su mamá. —Voy a hacer un viaje alrededor del mundo para salvar a mi gato —dice Emil.

subtitle.line: Emil loves his cat, and starts packing straight away. ‘What are you doing darling?’ Asks his mum. ‘I’m going on a trip around the world to save my cat’ Emil says.
Emil loves his cat, and starts packing straight away. ‘What are you doing darling?’ Asks his mum. ‘I’m going on a trip around the world to save my cat’ Emil says.

line.words: —Ok, cariño. No olvides cepillar tus dientes. —dice su mamá.

subtitle.line: ‘OK darling. Don’t forget to brush your teeth!’ Says his mum.
‘OK darling. Don’t forget to brush your teeth!’ Says his mum.

line.words: Emil encuentra su pasaporte y lo pone dentro de su bolsa.

subtitle.line: Emil finds his passport. He puts it in his bag.
Emil finds his passport. He puts it in his bag.

line.words: Emil encuentra su dinero y lo pone dentro de su bolsa.

subtitle.line: Emil finds his money. He puts it in his bag.
Emil finds his money. He puts it in his bag.

line.words: Emil encuentra su balón de football y lo pone dentro de su bolsa.

subtitle.line: Emil finds his football. He puts it in his bag.
Emil finds his football. He puts it in his bag.

line.words: Emil encuentra el teléfono de su padre y lo pone dentro de su bolsa.

subtitle.line: Emil finds his dad’s telephone. He puts it in his bag.
Emil finds his dad’s telephone. He puts it in his bag.

line.words: Va a la computadora y reserva un boleto. Él va a ir a España, después México y después a Cuba.

subtitle.line: He goes to the computer and reserves a ticket. He is going to Spain, then Mexico and then Cuba.
He goes to the computer and reserves a ticket. He is going to Spain, then Mexico and then Cuba.

line.words: Él deja su casa. —¡Bye, ma! —le dice. —¡Adiós cariño! Que tengas un lindo día en la escuela. —le responde su mamá

subtitle.line: He leaves his house. ‘Bye mum!’ he calls. ‘Bye darling! Have a nice day at school.’ His mum says.
He leaves his house. ‘Bye mum!’ he calls. ‘Bye darling! Have a nice day at school.’ His mum says.

line.words: Él se va al aeropuerto y recoge el boleto.

subtitle.line: He goes to the airport and collects his ticket.
He goes to the airport and collects his ticket.

line.words: Se sube al avión. Él está nervioso pero emocionado.

subtitle.line: He gets on the plane. He is nervous, but very excited.
He gets on the plane. He is nervous, but very excited.

line.words: El avión aterriza en el aeropuerto de Barcelona. El aeropuerto se llama (*). Después, Emil se va en metro a la ciudad.

subtitle.line: The plane lands at the airport in Barcelona. The airport is called ‘Charles de Gaule.’ Then Emil goes by metro into the city.
The plane lands at the airport in Barcelona. The airport is called ‘Charles de Gaule.’ Then Emil goes by metro into the city.

line.words: Emil mira a su alrededor. Él está sorprendido por el río y los puentes. —¡Mira! –dice. —Ese se llama Pont Neuf. —dice alguien que pasaba a su lado.

subtitle.line: Emil looks around. He is amazed at the river and the bridges. ‘Look at them!’ he says. ‘That one is called Pont Neuf’ says a passerby.
Emil looks around. He is amazed at the river and the bridges. ‘Look at them!’ he says. ‘That one is called Pont Neuf’ says a passerby.

line.words: Después él ve a un niño que va hacia la escuela. —¡Hola! ¿Vas hacia la escuela? —Sí –dice el niño—, voy en bicicleta. Tengo algo para ti. El niño le da a Emil una fotografía rota y sigue adelante.

subtitle.line: Then he sees a boy on his way to school. ‘Hello! Are you going to school?’ ‘Yes’ says the boy. ‘I go by bike. I have something for you.’ The boy gives Emil a torn photograph and rides off.
Then he sees a boy on his way to school. ‘Hello! Are you going to school?’ ‘Yes’ says the boy. ‘I go by bike. I have something for you.’ The boy gives Emil a torn photograph and rides off.

line.words: Emil pone la fotografía rota cuidadosamente en su bolsa, entra a la estación del metro y se va en metro al aeropuerto. ¡Siguiente parada, México!

subtitle.line: Emil puts the torn photograph carefully into his bag, goes to the metro station and goes by metro to the airport. ‘Next stop Mexico!’
Emil puts the torn photograph carefully into his bag, goes to the metro station and goes by metro to the airport. ‘Next stop Mexico!’

line.words: Después de un largo viaje, Emil llega al aeropuerto en la capital de Mali, Bamako. La ciudad es grande, llena de gente y es muy calurosa.

subtitle.line: After a long flight Emil arrives at the airport in the capital of Mali, Bamako. The city is big, crowded and hot.
After a long flight Emil arrives at the airport in the capital of Mali, Bamako. The city is big, crowded and hot.

line.words: Emil toma un camión hacia la ciudad. —¿Por qué la ciudad se llama Bamako? —pregunta. —Bamako significa “río de cocodrilo” en nuestra lengua local bambara. —dice la señorita.

subtitle.line: Emil takes a bus into the city. Why is this city called ‘Bamako?’ he says. ‘Bamako means ‘crocodile river’ in our local language Bambara’ says a lady.
Emil takes a bus into the city. Why is this city called ‘Bamako?’ he says. ‘Bamako means ‘crocodile river’ in our local language Bambara’ says a lady.

line.words: —En Mali hablamos francés y también bambara. —dice la señorita.

subtitle.line: ‘In Mali we speak French as well as Bambara.’ says the lady.
‘In Mali we speak French as well as Bambara.’ says the lady.

line.words: Después, Emil ve a una niña que pasa caminando. Ella lleva puesto el uniforme de la escuela.

subtitle.line: Then Emil sees a girl walking past. She has a school uniform on.
Then Emil sees a girl walking past. She has a school uniform on.

line.words: —¡Hola! ¿Vas hacia la escuela? —Sí —dice la niña—, voy a pie a la escuela. Tengo algo para ti. La niña le da a Emil otra fotografía rota y sigue adelante.

subtitle.line: ‘Hello! Are you going to school?’ Yes says the girl. ‘I walk to school. I have something for you.’ The girl gives Emil another torn photograph and walks off.
‘Hello! Are you going to school?’ Yes says the girl. ‘I walk to school. I have something for you.’ The girl gives Emil another torn photograph and walks off.

line.words: Emil pone la fotografía rota cuidadosamente en su bolsa, se va a la parada de camión y se va en camión al aeropuerto. ¡Siguiente parada, Cuba!

subtitle.line: Emil puts the torn photograph carefully into his bag, goes to the bus stop and goes by bus to the airport. ‘Next stop Cuba!
Emil puts the torn photograph carefully into his bag, goes to the bus stop and goes by bus to the airport. ‘Next stop Cuba!

line.words: Después de un corto viaje, Emil llega al aeropuerto en Martinica. Él toma un taxico a la capital, Fort-de-France. Para parar el taxico tiene que gritar “¡arrêt!.

subtitle.line: After a short flight Emil arrives at the airport in Martinique. He takes a taxico to the capital, Fort-de-France. To stop the taxico he has to shout ‘arrêt!’
After a short flight Emil arrives at the airport in Martinique. He takes a taxico to the capital, Fort-de-France. To stop the taxico he has to shout ‘arrêt!’

line.words: Forte-de-France es caluroso y movido pero más pequeño que Bamako. Está en la costa.

subtitle.line: Fort-de-France is hot and busy, but smaller than Bamako. It is on the coast.
Fort-de-France is hot and busy, but smaller than Bamako. It is on the coast.

line.words: En un pequeño parque, Emil ve a unos hombres tocando instrumentos. Él escucha su música.

subtitle.line: In a little park Emil sees some men playing instruments. He listens to the music.
In a little park Emil sees some men playing instruments. He listens to the music.

line.words: ¡La música es fantástica! —¿Qué es? –pregunta. —Se llama Zouk, ¡es muy popular aquí! —dice uno de los hombres

subtitle.line: ‘The music is fantastic! What is it?’ he asks. ‘It is called ‘Zouk’ – it is very popular here!’ says one of the men.
‘The music is fantastic! What is it?’ he asks. ‘It is called ‘Zouk’ – it is very popular here!’ says one of the men.

line.words: Entonces, Emil ve a una niña pasando en un taxico. Ella lleva puesto el uniforme de la escuela y tiene el cabello trenzado.

subtitle.line: Then Emil sees a girl passing in a taxico. She has a school uniform on and plaits in her hair.
Then Emil sees a girl passing in a taxico. She has a school uniform on and plaits in her hair.

line.words: —¡Hola! ¿Vas hacia la escuela? —Sí —dice el niña—, voy en taxico a la escuela. Tengo algo para ti. La niña le da a Emil otra fotografía rota y sigue adelante.

subtitle.line: ‘Hello! Are you going to school?’ Yes says the girl. ‘I go to school by taxixo. I have something for you.’ The girl gives Emil another torn photograph and rides away.
‘Hello! Are you going to school?’ Yes says the girl. ‘I go to school by taxixo. I have something for you.’ The girl gives Emil another torn photograph and rides away.

line.words: —¡Tiempo de irse a casa! —dice Emil. Él se va al aeropuerto en taxi y se va a casa en avión.

subtitle.line: ‘Time to go home!’ Says Emil. He goes to the airport by taxi – and goes home by plane.
‘Time to go home!’ Says Emil. He goes to the airport by taxi – and goes home by plane.

line.words: En el avión Emil saca las 3 partes de la fotografía. ¡Quedan exactas como un rompecabezas! Él mira cuidadosamente la foto.

subtitle.line: On the aeroplane Emil takes out the 3 torn pieces of photograph. They match up like a puzzle! He looks carefully at the picture.
On the aeroplane Emil takes out the 3 torn pieces of photograph. They match up like a puzzle! He looks carefully at the picture.

line.words: La foto es de una niña, es su vecina, ¡Juanita!

subtitle.line: The picture is of a girl – it’s his neighbour Juanita!
The picture is of a girl – it’s his neighbour Juanita!

line.words: Él va directamente a casa de Juanita del aeropuerto. Ella ya llegó de la escuela. —¡Hola, Emil! ¡Tu gato está aquí!

subtitle.line: He goes straight to Juanita’s house from the airport. She is back from school. ‘Hi Emil! Your cat is here!’
He goes straight to Juanita’s house from the airport. She is back from school. ‘Hi Emil! Your cat is here!’

line.words: Emil está muy feliz. Él se va a casa con su gato. —Hola cariño —dice su mamá

subtitle.line: Emil is very happy. He goes home with his cat. ‘Hello darling’ says his mum. ‘How was school?’
Emil is very happy. He goes home with his cat. ‘Hello darling’ says his mum. ‘How was school?’
